qas.question: At what age, since 2012, are men allowed to serve a mission after high school graduation?
At what age, since 2012, are women allowed to serve a mission after high school graduation?
How long is a full-time mission for males?
How long is a full-time mission for females?
What percentage of graduates had taken a hiatus from their BYU studies to serve as an LDS missionary?

plausible_answers.text: took a hiatus from their undergraduate studies at one point to serve as LDS missionaries

qas.question: What did 97% of female BYU graduates do?

plausible_answers.text: took a hiatus from their undergraduate studies at one point to serve as LDS missionaries

qas.question: What did 32% of male BYU graduates do?

plausible_answers.text: young men could serve a mission after they turn 18 and have graduated from high school, rather than after age 19 under the old policy

qas.question: What did the LSD Church announce in October 2012?
When can female students begin their missionary service now instead of 18?

context: Some <a4_0>97<a4_0/> percent of male BYU graduates and 32 percent of female graduates <b5_0><b6_0>took a hiatus from their undergraduate studies at one point to serve as LDS missionaries<b6_0/><b5_0/>. In October 2012, the LDS Church announced at its general conference that <b7_0>young men could serve a mission after they turn <a0_0>18<a0_0/> and have graduated from high school, rather than after age 19 under the old policy<b7_0/>. Many young men would often attend a semester or two of higher education prior to beginning missionary service. This policy change will likely impact what has been the traditional incoming freshman class at BYU. Female students may now begin their missionary service <b8_0>anytime after turning <a1_0>19<b8_0/><a1_0/>, rather than age 21 under the previous policy. For males, a full-time mission is <a2_0>two years<a2_0/> in length, and for females it lasts <a3_0>18 months<a3_0/>.
